title: 104_s1902
content: The Act titled "National Senior Citizen Hall of Fame Act of 1996" is established for the recognition of senior citizens. Congress finds that the senior population in the United States is projected to reach 35 million by 2000, 40 million by 2010, and 70 million by 2030, with minority populations making up 25 percent of the elderly population by 2030. The older population in the United States is growing, with 5,500 individuals celebrating their 65th birthday each day. Older Americans contribute valuable wisdom and leadership to the nation, embracing patriotism and passing on noble virtues to future generations. The purpose of this Act is to establish a National Senior Citizen Hall of Fame Commission, encourage Senior Citizen Hall of Fame establishments in all states, honor deserving citizens for their achievements and contributions to older Americans, and use the Alabama Senior Citizens Hall of Fame as a model. The curr_chunk is about using the Alabama Senior Citizens Hall of Fame as a model for establishing State Senior Citizens Hall of Fame. Establishment of Commission for State Senior Citizens Hall of Fame. The National Senior Citizen Hall of Fame Commission is established with up to 56 members appointed by each State. Initial appointments must be made by January 1, 1997, for a 1-year term starting on January 1. The National Senior Citizen Hall of Fame Commission members are appointed for a 1-year term starting on January 1. Vacancies do not affect the Commission's powers and are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Commission must hold its first meeting within 30 days of a majority of members being appointed, and meetings are called by the Chairperson. A majority of members constitute a quorum, and the Commission selects a Chairperson and Vice Chairperson from its members. The Commission is responsible for honoring citizens for their contributions to older Americans. They can provide awards as deemed appropriate and have the power to hold meetings, establish committees, and accept gifts. Authorization of appropriations is also granted. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Sums may be appropriated to enable the Commission to carry out the Act's purposes. Appropriated funds remain available without fiscal year limitation.
